intro: Auricula, commonly known as the auricula plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the Primulaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, spurred flowers that resemble small ears, hence its name. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and is native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. Auricula has lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of colorful flowers in shades of red, yellow, and white. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is considered a hardy perennial in temperate climates.
